content: **patchwork sittingpad english** patchwork sittingpad are simple seat pads in garter stitch the pattern is suitable for a beginner and it is absolutely perfect for leftover yarn the pattern is written and test-knitted for one knitting gauge needle size and yarn recommendation but you can mix several different yarn qualities as long as they are made of pure wool approximately the same thickness 50 g = around 80 m and can be felted patchwork sittingpad is worked square by square in garter stitch you start by knitting a single square squares are added in height simply by changing the color of the yarn a row of squares is added in width by casting on new stitches the squares are sewn together edge to edge using the garter stitch seam-technique so that the seam is almost invisible the seat pad can be finished as it is or alternatively you can pick up stitches and bind off with i-cord bind-off for a very neat and slightly more advanced finish finally the seat pad is felted in the washing machine this pattern is published as part of quistknit s fall-winter collection for 2025 path to a memory **sizes ** small large = 4x5 5x6 squares **finished measurements before felting ** 42x52 52x62 cm **finished measurements after felting ** approx 30x40 40x50 cm **gauge before felting ** 16 stitches per 10 cm **suggested needle size ** 5 mm us 8 it s nice to have 1 long circular needle + a couple of double pointed needles when knitting the sitting pad **suggested yarn ** rauma garn vams 50 g = 83 m the pattern is suitable for leftovers including mixed qualities you must use yarn that can be felted **estimated yarn quantity total ** 250 350 g **estimated yarn quantity per square ** 10 g **level of difficulty ** 2/5 1/5 if you skip the i-cord edge this product is a digital knitting pattern that you will receive as a pdf file for download you will receive the pattern in all available languages ​​ norwegian and english translations into additional languages ​​can be
